page.title: 11Guilsborough C.E.Primary
page.content: This school was founded in 1609 as a Free Writing School,it was re-built in 1867-this part is now the infant recep- tion classroom.New classrooms were added 1907,during the 1920's,1950's and 1970's.It is a Church of England Aided School,the Rev.W.Gibbs being the chair- man of the Governors.There are now 67 infants and 96 juniors in the school. As schools in the surrounding villages of Ravensthorpe,Cold Ashby,Thornby, Hollowell and Cottesbrooke have closed due to falling rolls the children remaining have been bused to Guils- borough.This is particularly easy as transport is already laid on for the secondary pupils to the Guilsborough Comprehensive School.The present headteacher is Mr.A.P.Jones,there are five other full time teaching staff and eight support staff.
